I have biopsy and MRI test next week.
Posts.Title: PSA 35 2 year after prostate surgery

I really mixed up.can he say that without a biopsy or etc.? Is it possible that the biopsy or MRI results show noncancerous? please help me.
Posts.Title: PSA 35 2 year after prostate surgery

Posts.Content: I want to see another comments. please advise me. Is it possible to conclude that form the results are pretty obvious I have cancer?
Posts.Title: PSA 35 2 year after prostate surgery

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by wolfgang I am really sorry to hear that your PSA number has elevated after the prostate surgery. The PSA findings in the blood may come from prostate tumors only. The abbreviation comes from Prostate Specific Antigen so your blood test results indicate that some leftovers from the originating tumor are still releasing such antigens in your blood. Only special tests like biopsy or imaging may detect now what exactly is going on in your body and to what extent your PCa has spread. The initial tests that detected the existing PCa that led to your prostatectomy were very important to tell the surgeon what had to be removed at the time of the surgery. My biopsy results were devastating, I had most aggressive malignant tumor in my prostate (Gleason score 4+5) which required immediate radical prostatectomy and everything around that might be affected with such an aggressive tumor. Besides the prostate and seminal vesicles, they had removed 22 lymph nodes. Everything removed was sent to detailed pathology examining in order to categorize the PCa stage and to anticipate the further healing process. You lack of more detailed tests, what was found and what was expected in future. I hope that after more tests are done you'll have more clear picture what options you have toward your healing. Right now without those test results it is difficult to say what are those options, even for more educated person as your doctor is. thank you for your respond.After I do biopsy and MRI , I,ll be here. Do you think this is cancer? Is it possible not to be cancer ?

Posts.Content: Im 71. 2 year after prostate surgery my blood test result is: 2014-06-01 PSA 34.57 Free PSA 5.82 Free PSA/PSA 0.17 Alkaline phosphates 201 Total Bilirubin 1.06 normal range 0.2-1.2 Direct Bilirubin 0.43 normal range up to 0.4 creatinine 1.28 normal range 0.6-1.2 CBC WBC 7800 RBC 5.58 Hemoglobin 16.8 Hematocrit 48.2 MCV 86.4 MCH 30.1 MCHC 34.9 RDW 13.4 Platelet Count 153 MPV 10.3 2014-06-11(in other laboratory) PSA 35.2 F-PSA 4.7 F-PSA/PSA Ratio 0.13 What do you think about? I have biopsy and MRI test next week.

Posts.Title: PSA 35 2 year after prostate surgery

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by wolfgang I am really sorry to hear that your PSA number has elevated after the prostate surgery. The PSA findings in the blood may come from prostate tumors only. The abbreviation comes from Prostate Specific Antigen so your blood test results indicate that some leftovers from the originating tumor are still releasing such antigens in your blood. Only special tests like biopsy or imaging may detect now what exactly is going on in your body and to what extent your PCa has spread. The initial tests that detected the existing PCa that led to your prostatectomy were very important to tell the surgeon what had to be removed at the time of the surgery. My biopsy results were devastating, I had most aggressive malignant tumor in my prostate (Gleason score 4+5) which required immediate radical prostatectomy and everything around that might be affected with such an aggressive tumor. Besides the prostate and seminal vesicles, they had removed 22 lymph nodes. Everything removed was sent to detailed pathology examining in order to categorize the PCa stage and to anticipate the further healing process. You lack of more detailed tests, what was found and what was expected in future. I hope that after more tests are done you'll have more clear picture what options you have toward your healing. Right now without those test results it is difficult to say what are those options, even for more educated person as your doctor is. thank you for your respond.After I do biopsy and MRI , I,ll be here. Do you think this is cancer? Is it possible not to be cancer ?
Posts.Title: PSA 35 2 year after prostate surgery

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Hope2012 Unfortunately we are not medical professionals here, so we can't tell you what you are looking for. If you cant talk to you doctor about the side effects, can you go to your local drug store and talk to a pharmacist? They are usually trained in the side effects of medications. Good luck. Thank you.I asked from pharmacists but they don,t know about it!!! and say only doctors can tell you about it and doctors say we dont have enough time for explain.that is the reason I ask this question here. I read about your father and I'm really sorry for events that occurred.I can only repeat your quotation "This dark night shall end and the sun will rise again... Believe" Thank you
